name: Which Richard Do You know? Online Quiz | Name Game | 10 Questions

questions.text: Richard I of England was married to which lady?
questions.explanation:
Berengaria of Navarre.

	Eleanor was Richard the Lionheart's {mother;} the other ladies lived in later centuries.

questions.text: Richard III fell at which battle?
questions.explanation:
Bosworth.

	Bosworth Field - according to Shakespeare, site of Richard's cry 'My kingdom for a horse!'

questions.text: This 17th century Richard was a cavalier and poet. What is his surname?
questions.explanation:
Lovelace.

	He wrote poems to his love 'Lucasta'.

questions.text: Sir Richard of Chichester is known as the author of what?
questions.explanation:
Prayer.

	A famous prayer - 'That I may fight and not heed the {wounds;} that I may labour and not seek any reward save that of knowing that I do Thy will' etc, still read and sung in churches today

questions.text: A cousin of Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Richard was the Duke of which English city?
questions.explanation:
Gloucester.

	A cousin of the Queen, he trained as an architect but inherited the title when his older brother was killed.

questions.text: What was Richard Nixon's middle name?
questions.explanation:
Milhous.

	He was nicknamed "Tricky Dick" and will always be associated with the Watergate scandal.

questions.text: This Richard was the composer of "Der Rosenkavalier", and shares his surname with other composers. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Strauss & Richard Strauss.

	Richard Strauss also wrote songs and symphonies, and the symphonic poem "Also Sprach Zarathustra".

questions.text: Richard Burton met Elizabeth Taylor on the set of which film?
questions.explanation:
Cleopatra.

	They were both married at the time - and later married each other, twice.

questions.text: This Richard is the British architect of the Pompidou Centre. What is his surname?
questions.explanation:
Rogers.

	His trademark is 'inside-out architecture', with the pipework on display. Another of his landmarks is the Lloyds building in London.

questions.text: Which of these films did NOT star Richard Gere?
questions.explanation:
Top Gun.

	That one was Tom Cruise ... but Richard did appear in uniform in An Officer and a Gentleman.
